intro: Sarcogonum tamnifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf sarcogonum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
